Northern Ireland’s Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs has immediately moved to introduce bird flu control restrictions in Co. Fermanagh following confirmation today that bird flu was identified in a commercial turkey flock in Co. Monaghan.

It is understood that testing for bird flu has been carried out on a number of commercial sites over the weekend and was identified in a premises which lies close to the border between Monaghan and Fermanagh.
